pr_title: Update all E2E tests to integrate with CMS

timeline.bodyText: should this be beforeall instead of beforeeach? Doesn't really seem necessary to upload for every test (even though it won't actually upload because it will already exist)
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: That's an option. I was trying to reuse the cms client in kernel so couldn't make it in beforeall. But this should be easy to change.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Also, should we be deleting the packages when the test completes?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: delete api is not implemented yet. We don't have a way to delete the components. Is it ok to leave these artifacts in test accounts for now?
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: I think the delete API exists though. Even if it doesn't do anything; I'd add the code to delete it now, that way we can't forget to add it.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Still applies as delete api is not available for cleanup. (the delete request in aftereach is not actually doing anything)
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: Can you change the string to be "implementers" since that is the proper spelling anyway?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: doesn't this request need to include the platforms too? Or is is just the recipe only?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: The request does not include platforms. The recipe should have a "Platforms" key with a list of supported platforms.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: move this inside the try, then you don't need to pre-declare length.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: why are you wrapping this with a list? It already is a list.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Without this change, ln112 packageMetadataList.addAll will throw UnsupportedOperationException
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.message: Update all E2E tests to integrate with CMS

timeline.bodyText: Nit - While this helps us consolidate all interactions with component management service behind a facade, I would prefer if code that is only used by tests stays in test utils, it will prevent any misunderstandings, and we will be able to only package what we really want to ship as part of the executables. When we eventually move E2E tests out of the current repository, we will need to remember to clean this up
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -97,4 +111,100 @@ PackageRecipe downloadPackageRecipe(PackageIdentifier packageIdentifier)
             throw new PackageLoadingException(errorMsg, e);
         }
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Create a component with the given recipe file.
+     *
+     * @param cmsClient client of Component Management Service
+     * @param recipeFilePath the path to the component recipe file
+     * @return {@Link CreateComponentResult}
+     * @throws IOException if file reading fails
+     */
+    public static CreateComponentResult createComponent(AWSGreengrassComponentManagement cmsClient,

replies.bodyText: Good point. I put it in prod code for now in case we want to keep the eg CLI functionality to promote packages and deployments. Currenlty CLI initializes new clients with creds required. Since we have a client in the kernel, I was thinking we can channel back the promote request from CLI and make the service call in kernel.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: Let's add a SIM for this. We really need a lot more tests here. And, by "this" I mean the package manager.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message: Add more unit tests for CMS service calls
Update github step to upload Coverage Report
